prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Info & Guidance for AI Crafting Response
mes:
Here is some background about Stefan, Suzanne, and Melissa:

Stefan and Suzanne are both in their early forties and both natives of Munich, Germany. They got married in April of 2016, eight years ago. Together, they have two daughters. The oldest is seven years old. The other is five years old.

 When Stefan married Suzanne, he took her surname instead of her taking his. and following the civil ceremony, as required in Germany, when Stefan sent out invitations to his long-distance relatives, from his personal email, inviting them to the formal ceremony - the joint signature that he signed, he put her name first instead of his.

Melissa is a woman that met Stefan and Suzanne four months ago when she traveled to Munich with her soon-to-be-ex-husband, Edward. Edward is Stefan's cousin. There was strong connection between Melissa and Stefan, although they did not act on it, and maintain respectful boundaries.
original_avatar: Info & Guidance for AI Crafting Response.png
swipes:
Here is some background about Stefan, Suzanne, and Melissa:

Stefan and Suzanne are both in their early forties and both natives of Munich, Germany. They got married in April of 2016, eight years ago. Together, they have two daughters. The oldest is seven years old. The other is five years old.

 When Stefan married Suzanne, he took her surname instead of her taking his. and following the civil ceremony, as required in Germany, when Stefan sent out invitations to his long-distance relatives, from his personal email, inviting them to the formal ceremony - the joint signature that he signed, he put her name first instead of his.

Melissa is a woman that met Stefan and Suzanne four months ago when she traveled to Munich with her soon-to-be-ex-husband, Edward. Edward is Stefan's cousin. There was strong connection between Melissa and Stefan, although they did not act on it, and maintain respectful boundaries.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
I have provided you with a horary chart that I have drawn up specifically asking: Did Stefan willingly submit his identity to Suzanne, if so, did he volunteer to do it, and why?

Stefan should be represented by the 9th house (foreign connection) and Me by the Ascendant.

I've provided a cross reference guide to help identify the houses concerning him due to his 9th house representation.

Please start by listing all relevant chart data for interpretation (ie. transits, aspects, patterns, etc.) from the horary chart using horary principles only. Then I will document them for the actual interpretations.

Remember to follow your directives and maintain accuracy to what is shown in the chart data. Think step by step taking a methodical approach.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Below is a summary of the horary chart data as it relates to your question. I have organized the information into groups for clarity. Remember that you are asking, “Did Stefan willingly submit his identity to Suzanne, if so, did he volunteer to do it, and why?” Melissa is represented by the Ascendant (1st house) and Stefan by the 9th house, which according to your cross‐reference corresponds to the chart’s 6th house influence.

──────────────────────────────
1. Basic Chart Structure

• Ascendant (Melissa’s self)
 – Degree & Sign: 23° Pisces
 – House 1 contains: Moon, Venus, Neptune, North Node, and Chiron

• House Cross Reference for Stefan’s matter
 – By your guide: Chart’s 6th House = Stefan’s 9th House
 – Chart’s 6th House begins at 9° Leo (no planets listed directly in this house)

──────────────────────────────
2. Planetary Positions

• Sun: 16° 1′ Aquarius
• Moon: 6° 20′ Taurus
• Mercury: 12° 26′ Aquarius
• Venus: 0° 11′ Aries
• Mars: 19° 28′ Cancer (retrograde)
• Jupiter: 11° 16′ Gemini
• Saturn: 17° 49′ Pisces
• Uranus: 23° 16′ Taurus
• Neptune: 28° 4′ Pisces
• Pluto: 2° 10′ Aquarius
• North Node: 29° 39′ Pisces (retrograde)
• Chiron: 19° 36′ Aries

──────────────────────────────
3. House Division (Key Houses)

• 1st House: Starts at 23° Pisces – contains Moon, Venus, Neptune, North Node, Chiron
• 2nd House: Starts at 11° Taurus – contains Uranus
• 3rd House: Starts at 8° Gemini – contains Jupiter
• 4th House: Starts at 26° Gemini
• 5th House: Starts at 14° Cancer – contains Mars
• 6th House: Starts at 9° Leo      ← (Stefan’s relevant house per your cross-reference, representing his 9th house matter)
• 7th House: Starts at 23° Virgo
• 8th House: Starts at 11° Scorpio
• 9th House: Starts at 8° Sagittarius
• 10th House: Starts at 26° Sagittarius
• 11th House: Starts at 14° Capricorn – contains Pluto
• 12th House: Starts at 9° Aquarius – contains Sun, Mercury, Saturn

──────────────────────────────
4. Major Aspects (Selected, as these may be particularly relevant for a horary analysis)

• Uranus Sextile Ascendant   (orb: 0°)
• Mars Square Chiron      (orb: 0°)
• MC Opposition IC      (orb: 0°)
• Neptune Conjunction North Node (orb: 1°)
• Venus Conjunction North Node  (orb: 1°)
• Mercury Trine Jupiter     (orb: 1°)
• Venus Sextile Pluto      (orb: 2°)
• Neptune Square both IC and MC (orb: 2°)
• Venus Conjunction Neptune   (orb: 2°)
• Mars Trine Saturn      (orb: 2°)
• Pluto Sextile North Node   (orb: 3°)
• Sun Sextile Chiron      (orb: 3°)

(The chart also contains further aspects with larger orbs, including oppositions and squares—these have been catalogued in the provided data.)

──────────────────────────────
5. Patterns & Special Configurations

• Stellium in Pisces (encompassing the Ascendant, North Node, Neptune, Saturn – along with Venus’s involvement via aspect)
• T-Square patterns involving the MC, IC, and North Node (with Neptune and Venus contributing to the configuration)
• The chart overall forms a Bowl Shape with an emphasis on the bottom left quadrant
• Matter of numerously recurring Square aspects (total of 13)

──────────────────────────────
6. Additional Timing & Contextual Data

• The Moon is a waxing crescent, a detail that can be significant in horary timing.
• The chart’s quadrant emphasis (top right empty) suggests matters of public projection may be less involved, shifting focus to personal/internal forces.
• The distribution of modes and the placement of internal versus external planets have been noted and will be considered in the interpretation.

──────────────────────────────
This data should serve as a factual basis for further interpretation. Please review these details to ensure all necessary points are documented before proceeding with the interpretative phase.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Thank you, Madame. Please, proceed to interpretation.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
The chart’s data indicates that Stefan’s act of submitting his identity to Suzanne appears to have been voluntary. The planetary configuration—with the watery, melding energies around the Ascendant (Melissa’s representation) and the dynamic interplay affecting the cross‐referenced 6th house (Stefan’s representation of his 9th house matter)—points to an inner compulsion toward unity rather than coercion.

Key details include the strong Pisces stellium in the Ascendant, where Neptune and the North Node blend idealistic love with a sense of karmic destiny. This suggests that the merging of identities was spiritually and emotionally motivated. The conjunction of Venus with both Neptune and the North Node further supports a union based on deep affection and a desire for oneness. Meanwhile, Mercury’s clear, rational placement in Aquarius indicates that despite the idealism, the decision was reached with conscious resolve.

The absence of challenging planetary placements directly in the 6th house implies that external pressure or obligation was minimal. Rather, the evidence suggests Stefan’s willingness emerged from a self-initiated, transformative act—a voluntary surrender of a personal emblem in favor of a greater shared identity with Suzanne. The presence of Mars square Chiron, however, hints at some emotional residue or vulnerability, meaning this sacrifice was not without its personal costs.

Based on these elements, Stefan’s submission of his identity appears to have been a deliberate, heartfelt act born from both love and a profound sense of destiny.
